items.title: Analog chipmaker SiTime agrees to acquire Tokyo-based Renesas' timing unit for $1.5B in cash and 4.13M shares in a ~$2.9B deal, set to close by the end of 2026 (Bloomberg)
items.summary:
Bloomberg:
Analog chipmaker SiTime agrees to acquire Tokyo-based Renesas' timing unit for $1.5B in cash and 4.13M shares in a ~$2.9B deal, set to close by the end of 2026  —  Analog chipmaker SiTime Corp. has agreed to acquire Renesas Electronics Corp.'s timing unit in a cash-and-stock transaction valued at about $2.9 billion.

items.title: Save on Apple Watch Ultra 3, or land Ultra 2 at up to $379 off the orig. list price

Still a wonderful wearable and one you can score at a whole lot less than the latest series 3, new units are still as much as $200 off right now and we spotted some compelling refurb options at as much as $379 off the original list price.

items.title: Wall Street's idea that a software pure play will "vanish" into an LLM is "nonsense": we need more software, and AI-enabled software moves up the product stack (Steven Sinofsky/@stevesi)

Steven Sinofsky / @stevesi:
Wall Street's idea that a software pure play will “vanish” into an LLM is “nonsense”: we need more software, and AI-enabled software moves up the product stack  —  Too much of what is going on is a race to get to a theoretical end state of a whole new world of business and technology.

The Beats Powerbeats Fit are $139.99 (reg. $199.99) right now, and they’re a strong pick if you want earbuds that stay locked in, sound great, and handle calls and workouts without drama. These are open-box, which essentially means they’re excess retail inventory that, while they may show a bit of handling, are still verified as new and repackaged cleanly. You probably know that there are a lot of earbuds out there that sound great—until you start moving, take a call outside, or hit that point in the day where everything needs to happen at once. That’s why these are most definitely worth a look.
